description:
boto is a big obstacle in py33 env.  It is not supported by py33.



Downloading/unpacking boto>=2.4.0,!=2.13.0 (from -r /opt/stack/nova/requirements.txt (line 6))
  Running setup.py egg_info for package boto
    Traceback (most recent call last):
      File "<string>", line 16, in <module>
      File "/opt/stack/nova/.tox/py33/build/boto/setup.py", line 37, in <module>
        from boto import __version__
      File "./boto/__init__.py", line 27, in <module>
        from boto.pyami.config import Config, BotoConfigLocations
      File "./boto/pyami/config.py", line 185
        print s.getvalue()
              ^
    SyntaxError: invalid syntax

    print s.getvalue()
title: boto is not supported in py33 env

boto is a big obstacle in py33 env.  It is not supported by py33.



Downloading/unpacking boto>=2.4.0,!=2.13.0 (from -r /opt/stack/nova/requirements.txt (line 6))

comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~skuicloud

comments.content:
http://python3wos.appspot.com/

boto is the only top ten python packages which don't support Python 3.x.

Related discussion:
http://comments.gmane.org/gmane.comp.python.boto/3152

Cited from above thread:
-----------------
Mitchell Garnaat | 25 Jul 2013 02:32
 Gravatar 
Re: Boto - the *only* project in the top 10 that doesn't support Python 3

Hi -

The boto project is an open source community project that is also supported by Amazon.  Amazon's contributions have been considerable.  They employ me and several other core boto developers.

Our strategic answer for Python 3 support is boto3 which will be as big of a deal to the boto community as Python 3 was to the Python community.  We have laid the ground work for boto3 with botocore which is the low-level library upon which we are building boto3.  It fully supports Python 2.6, Python 2.7, and Python 3.3.  I can't provide a specific timeframe for boto3 but you should start seeing some initial designs and prototypes on github in the near future.

In the meantime, you might want to check out the py3kport branch.  This work was contributed by the community and I know it is being used successfully to run boto in Python 3.x by a number of people.  Or, depending on your requirements, you could also check out botocore.  It provides great low-level coverage across the services.

Mitch
-----------------

comments.content: boto officially supports py33 now http://python3wos.appspot.com/
